scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains administrative files and transparencies and photographs of artwork belonging to the Yale Center for British Art.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Imaging Services department is responsible for the creation, digitization, and management of new and existing photography of the Center's collections, architecture, and selected events. Imaging Services works to document the Center's collections, and to maintain image and rights-related information in both the Center's collections management database and the digital asset management system. The department also handles technical photography for the Center's Conservation department, including infrared and ultraviolet digital imaging. Imaging Services staff members serve as a resource for the Center and the University in the areas of digital photography, fine art reproduction, copyright, and digital asset management.
